original: Laurell, Johan Henrik, prakt, läkare, Halmstad, f. 29/7/90 i Jönköp. av hovr :assessor Nathanael L. o. Anna Kugelberg. G. 25 m. fil. kand. Louise Killander. Barn: Christer f. 26, Claès-Fredrik 29, Stephan 33. — Stud :ex. i Jönköping 10, jur. stud. i Uppsala 10-12, med. kand. där 17, med. lic. vid Karolinska institutet 24. Stud:-res. tid Köpenhamn 25 och till Budapest o. Utrecht 39. Assist :läk. samt e. läk. v. Södertälje las. 22, und :läk. v. Löw^enströmska las. 24-27, därunder tf. lasiläk. sju mån., tf. läk, v. Neder-kalix sjukstuga två mån. 27, tf. bitr. läk. v. Seraf :las. öron-, näs- o. hals-poliklin. 27-28, tf. förste und:läk. v. Borås las. 28, andre undrläk. v. Halm.-stads las. 28-29, prakt. läk. i Halmstad samt läk. v. barnhemmet där sed. 30, läk. v. S:t Olofshemmet där 32-33, tf. andre stadsläk. 32-33 o. i>oliklinikläk. sed. 36, tf. provrläk. i Fjugesta 44, e. läk. v. beredsk rsjukh. i Ulricehamn 45. V. ordf. i pens rnd 38, ordf. där 45. ordf. i Hall. läkrfören. 38-40. Utg. ett flert. skr. i med., kosmobiolog., pedagog. o. medicinalhist. ämnen. Komp. f. kammarmusik. Hobby r astronomi. SvRK förtj rplak. i silver. Sv res scout-förb. förtj rplak. i brons.
translated:
Laurell, Johan Henrik, MD, physician, Halmstad, born on July 29, 1890 in Jönköping, son of Court of Appeal Assessor Nathanael L. and Anna Kugelberg. Married on May 25 to Louise Killander, with whom he had three children: Christer, born in 1926, Claès-Fredrik, born in 1929, and Stephan, born in 1933. 

He completed his undergraduate studies in Jönköping in 1910, studied law in Uppsala from 1910 to 1912, obtained a Bachelor of Medicine degree there in 1917, and a medical license from the Karolinska Institute in 1924. He undertook study trips to Copenhagen in 1925 and to Budapest and Utrecht in 1939. 

He worked as an assistant physician and junior physician at Södertälje Hospital from 1922, at Löwenström Hospital from 1924 to 1927 (including a temporary position as hospital doctor for seven months), at Nederkalix Hospital for two months in 1927, at Seraf Hospital's ear, nose, and throat clinic from 1927 to 1928, as temporary senior junior physician at Borås Hospital in 1928, as second junior physician at Halmstad Hospital from 1928 to 1929, and as a practicing physician in Halmstad and physician at the local orphanage since 1930. He worked as a physician at St. Olof's Home from 1932 to 1933, as temporary deputy city physician from 1932 to 1933, and as an outpatient clinic physician since 1936. He was also temporary examining physician in Fjugesta in 1944 and a physician at a military hospital in Ulricehamn in 1945. 

He served as vice chairman of the Pensioners' Association in 1938 and chairman in 1945. He was also chairman of the Halland Medical Association from 1938 to 1940. He published several works in the fields of medicine, cosmobiology, pedagogy, and medical history. He was also a chamber music composer and had a hobby in astronomy. He was awarded the Royal Swedish Order of Vasa in silver and the Swedish National Scout Association's bronze medal of merit.
